resources.string: Your donations help me maintain my projects.\n\nTap on a button below to open it in your browser.
To import secrets from Bitwarden, export an unencrypted Bitwarden JSON file and place it in the following directory:
Export your accounts and take a picture of the QR code. Make sure it is a JPG/PNG image and place it in the following directory:
Take a picture of a QR code, make sure it is a JPG/PNG image and place it in the following directory:
To import secrets from Aegis Authenticator, export an unencrypted Aegis JSON file and place it in the following directory:
To import secrets from andOTP, export an unencrypted andOTP JSON file and place it in the following directory:
To import secrets from an old backup, place your WFS file in the following directory:

To import logins from a file, make sure you export them in an unencrypted JSON format and place them on your device's internal storage. You can then use the file picker below.

The following services are currently supported:
â‹… Aegis Authenticator
â‹… Bitwarden 
â‹… AndOTP

To import logins via ADB, make sure you export them in an unencrypted JSON format, and send them to this device via ADB commands. 

The following services are currently supported:
â‹… Aegis Authenticator
â‹… Bitwarden 
â‹… AndOTP 

Run these commands to send your export file to this device:

file=<file>
adb push $file /data/local/tmp/
adb shell run-as app.wristkey mkdir files/
adb shell run-as app.wristkey cp /data/local/tmp/$file files/
adb shell rm /data/local/tmp/$file
You can use the file picker, ADB or a file transfer app for this.

Can\'t connect to Wi-Fi network. Go to your device settings and connect to one before continuing.\n\nIf your device doesn\'t support Wi-Fi, try using the ADB transfer method instead.
Would you like to delete this item?
This QR code is invalid. Please try again.
Transfer data between two devices, such as a phone and a smartwatch
With both devices on the same Wi-Fi, open Wristkey on the other device, select the \"Receive\" option and scan the QR code shown on the other device.
With both devices on the same Wi-Fi, open Wristkey on the other device, select the \"Receive\" option and enter the IP shown.
With both devices on the same Wi-Fi, open Wristkey on the other device, select the \"Send\" option and scan this QR code or enter the IP shown.
Enter the OTP displayed on the other device to finish transfer.
Enter this OTP on the other device to complete transfer.
This is a Wristkey Wi-Fi transfer server. It is ephemeral and uses X25519 and AES encryption, no point wasting your time attacking it. ðŸ–•ðŸ˜‰
Scan this QR Code or enter the IP address shown below it.
